data.title: THE WAR AND TREATY SIGNS WITH ROUNDER RECORDS
data.meta_description: The War and Treaty, the duo whose riveting live performances and stirring recordings have earned them an ardent and loyal following among music cognoscenti in
data.text:
The War and Treaty, the duo whose riveting live performances and stirring recordings have earned them an ardent and loyal following among music cognoscenti in Nashville and beyond has signed with Rounder Records. Rounder President John Strohm remarked, “We are beyond thrilled to have the opportunity to work with The War and Treaty, a group that utilizes incredible vocal talent and extraordinary songwriting chops to deliver an affirming message of unity and inclusiveness that is very welcome in this age.” He continues, “They encompass many of Rounder’s genre traditions while crafting a fresh, exciting sound that is entirely their own.”

The husband and wife duo of Michael Trotter Jr. and Tanya Blount-Trotter is the subject of an in-depth profile that aired on CBS Sunday Morning on May 26. In the segment, veteran correspondent Conor Knighton recounts the couple’s compelling origin story, which touches on Michael Trotter’s experiences as an Iraqi War veteran and his struggles with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder; Tanya Blount-Trotter’s early career as a musician and actor; and brings us into their present-day lives as they balance the demands of making music together, marriage, and parenthood. View the story HERE.

Since forming in 2014, The War and Treaty has won tremendous acclaim and accolades. NPR Music praised the couple’s “ecstatic, empowering sense of partnership that serves as the duo’s creative engine and core message,” while the Associated Press dubbed them “a powerhouse R&B duo who sound as though they were born to sing together.”

This month, the Americana Music Association announced the nominations for its annual Honors & Awards, and The War and Treaty received nods in two categories: Duo/Group of the Year and Emerging Act of the Year. The awards show will take place in Nashville on September 11.

The group, which just wrapped up a run of dates opening for Al Green, will be on tour all summer including support dates with Brandi Carlile and Jason Isbell. They will also perform at Floydfest, XPonential Music Festival, Edmonton Folk Festival, and Dierks Bentley’s Seven Peaks Music Festival.

A full list of tour dates is below, and more shows will be announced in the coming weeks.

The War and Treaty’s debut for Rounder Records is slated for release in 2020.
